title: Sam Smith (basketball, born 1943)
summary: Samuel Chestley Smith Sr. (January 27, 1943 – May 18, 2022) was an American professional basketball player who played four seasons in the American Basketball Association (ABA).  He played for the Minnesota Muskies, Kentucky Colonels, and Utah Stars from 1967 to 1971.  Prior to turning professional, he was noted for being one of the first three African American basketball players at the University of Louisville.  He later transferred to Kentucky Wesleyan College and helped the school win its first NCAA Division II championship in 1966.
